result.markdown:
--- title: "About us" format: html editor: visual description: | Warwick R-user group is for everybody interested in R, the programming language for statistical computing, data science, visualisation and reproducible reporting. --- Warwick R User Group meets every 2 months to discuss R-related topics. At each session, speakers present interesting R packages (and how to make your own), share tips and tricks and offer advice to new R users. Everyone is welcome, regardless of R programming experience, from across or outside Warwick University. For further information, visit our Meetup.com page or contact a member of the [WRUG committee](about#committee). ## Committee ::: {.people-gallery} ::: {#person1}
Carlos Cámara-Menoyo

::: ::: ## Support Warwick R User Group is supported by the [R Consortium](https://www.r-consortium.org/). We follow the R Consortium [R Community code of conduct](https://wiki.r-consortium.org/view/R_Consortium_and_the_R_Community_Code_of_Conduct).
